signature:
private static <E> LevenshteinResults findDetailedResults(final SimilarityInput<E> left,
                                                          final SimilarityInput<E> right,
                                                          final int[][] matrix,
                                                          final boolean swapped)
name: findDetailedResults
javadoc:
/**
 * Finds detailed results of the Levenshtein distance calculation.
 *
 * This method is used to calculate the number of insertions, deletions and substitutions
 * required to transform one sequence into another. It uses a dynamic programming approach,
 * where the matrix of distances between characters in the two sequences is analyzed row by row.
 *
 * @param left  The first similarity input object.
 * @param right The second similarity input object.
 * @param matrix A 2D array representing the Levenshtein distance matrix.
 * @param swapped Whether to swap the roles of the two input objects (i.e., treat the
 *                second as the reference and the first as the target).
 *
 * @return An instance of {@link LevenshteinResults} containing the total number of operations,
 *         insertions, deletions and substitutions.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Finds detailed results of the Levenshtein distance calculation.
 *
 * This method is used to calculate the number of insertions, deletions and substitutions
 * required to transform one sequence into another. It uses a dynamic programming approach,
 * where the matrix of distances between characters in the two sequences is analyzed row by row.
 *
 * @param left  The first similarity input object.
 * @param right The second similarity input object.
 * @param matrix A 2D array representing the Levenshtein distance matrix.
 * @param swapped Whether to swap the roles of the two input objects (i.e., treat the
 *                second as the reference and the first as the target).
 *
 * @return An instance of {@link LevenshteinResults} containing the total number of operations,
 *         insertions, deletions and substitutions.
 */

name: getDefaultInstance
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the default instance of {@link LevenshteinDetailedDistance}, which should be used for all calculations.
 *
 * @return The default instance of {@link LevenshteinDetailedDistance} that has been initialized with a set of precomputed values to improve performance.
 */

signature: private static <E> LevenshteinResults limitedCompare(SimilarityInput<E> left, SimilarityInput<E> right, final int threshold)
name: limitedCompare
javadoc:
/**
 * Computes the limited Levenshtein distance between two strings.
 *
 * This implementation only computes the distance if it's less than or equal to
 * the threshold value, returning -1 if it's greater. The advantage is performance:
 * unbounded distance is O(nm), but a bound of k allows us to reduce it to O(km)
 * time by only computing a diagonal stripe of width 2k + 1 of the cost table.
 *
 * @param left    the first string
 * @param right   the second string
 * @param threshold the maximum distance to compute
 * @return the limited Levenshtein distance between the two strings, or -1 if it's greater than the threshold
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Computes the limited Levenshtein distance between two strings.
 *
 * This implementation only computes the distance if it's less than or equal to
 * the threshold value, returning -1 if it's greater. The advantage is performance:
 * unbounded distance is O(nm), but a bound of k allows us to reduce it to O(km)
 * time by only computing a diagonal stripe of width 2k + 1 of the cost table.
 *
 * @param left    the first string
 * @param right   the second string
 * @param threshold the maximum distance to compute
 * @return the limited Levenshtein distance between the two strings, or -1 if it's greater than the threshold
 */

signature: private static <E> LevenshteinResults unlimitedCompare(SimilarityInput<E> left, SimilarityInput<E> right)
name: unlimitedCompare
javadoc:
/**
 * Performs an unlimited Levenshtein comparison between two input strings.
 *
 * This implementation is optimized to handle large input strings by using a single-dimensional array
 * instead of a 2D matrix. It also swaps the input strings if necessary to consume less memory.
 *
 * @param left The first input string.
 * @param right The second input string.
 * @return A LevenshteinResults object containing the comparison results.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Performs an unlimited Levenshtein comparison between two input strings.
 *
 * This implementation is optimized to handle large input strings by using a single-dimensional array
 * instead of a 2D matrix. It also swaps the input strings if necessary to consume less memory.
 *
 * @param left The first input string.
 * @param right The second input string.
 * @return A LevenshteinResults object containing the comparison results.
 */

signature: public <E> LevenshteinResults apply(final SimilarityInput<E> left, final SimilarityInput<E> right)
name: apply
javadoc:
/**
 * Applies Levenshtein distance comparison between two input objects.
 *
 * @param left  The first input object to compare.
 * @param right The second input object to compare.
 * @return      The result of the Levenshtein distance comparison.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Applies Levenshtein distance comparison between two input objects.
 *
 * This method calculates the minimum number of single-character edits (insertions, deletions or substitutions) required to change one string into the other.
 * It returns a {@link LevenshteinResults} object containing the edit distance and a boolean indicating whether the strings are identical.
 *
 * @param left  The first input object to compare. Must not be null.
 * @param right The second input object to compare. Must not be null.
 * @return      A {@link LevenshteinResults} object containing the result of the Levenshtein distance comparison.
 */

name: getThreshold
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the current threshold value.
 *
 * @return The current threshold value as an Integer, or null if no threshold has been set.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves and returns the current threshold value that is being used for filtering or comparison purposes.
 *
 * @return The current threshold value as an Integer, or null if no threshold has been explicitly set. If a default threshold value exists, it will be returned instead of null.
 */
